name: axios
text:
British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has condemned "racist thuggery" after far-right groups clashed with police in central London, resulting in over 100 arrested  
https://t.co/WLln93BCqF

name: axios
text: NEW: A lawyer for the Rayshard Brooks' family has disputed the official account that the shooting happened after Br… https://t.co/CdVkWP9N8s

name: axios
text:
A top ABC News executive has been placed on administrative leave pending an investigation  following a HuffPost report alleging she used racist language about "Good Morning America" co-anchor Robin Roberts and other black staff 
https://t.co/kPhYaKifqo

name: axios
text: NEW: Police have fired the white officer who killed Rayshard Brooks and a second officer present during the shooting of the black Atlanta resident has been placed on administrative duty  https://t.co/LPN4YQheSF

name: axios
text: NEW: China has reported its highest daily number of new novel coronavirus cases for months https://t.co/rrsZx6VpLn

name: axios
text: Criminals are getting busy — and creative — with an onslaught of new frauds preying on people's fears and anxieties about the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/Zwk1Wz4YsQ

name: axios
text: Rep. Denver Riggleman (R-Va.), who became a target for social conservatives after officiating a same-sex wedding last year, has been defeated in a drive-thru GOP convention. https://t.co/kCz8HgVQfI

name: axios
text:
Ukrainian officials say they were offered $5 million in bribes to end a probe into Mykola Zlochevsky, the founder of energy company Burisma.

Anti-corruption officials stressed that the bribe had no connection to former Burisma board member Hunter Biden. https://t.co/jcFam3ucB8

name: axios
text: NEW: House Majority Whip James Clyburn pushes back on the idea of defunding the police on CNN, insisting that "police have a role to play" and that the system can be restructured in order to respond to the current crisis. https://t.co/JZ9SgJ8zbH

name: axios
text: HUD Secretary Ben Carson said on Fox that the fatal police shooting of Rayshard Brooks in Atlanta was “not clear-cut” like the killing of George Floyd, noting that Brooks was resisting arrest and that more information is necessary. https://t.co/V56VtMkH5W

name: axios
text: Stacey Abrams says the debate over defunding police is creating a "false choice idea." https://t.co/V8n9CY1LYW

name: axios
text:
Rep. Ilhan Omar defends the idea of dismantling the Minneapolis Police Department:

"You can't really reform a department that is rotten to the root. What you can do is rebuild." https://t.co/6xi5oPNR8T

name: axios
text: The death of Rayshard Brooks was the 48th officer-involved shooting the Georgia Bureau of Investigation has been asked to investigate this year, according to the Atlanta Journal-Constitution. https://t.co/LUngfiYMhi

name: axios
text:
Infectious-disease expert Michael Osterholm warns on Fox News of potential health risks at next week's Trump rally in Tulsa.

"Let me just put it really simply: Would I want my loved ones in a setting like that? Absolutely not." https://t.co/oVXeyRMRvd

name: axios
text: President Trump's move to deploy the National Guard in Washington, D.C. to respond to the protests that erupted after the killing of George Floyd cost taxpayers about $21 million, The Daily Beast reports. https://t.co/XUWpXNJNQ1

name: axios
text: France will reopen its borders with other European countries tonight at midnight after three months of travel restrictions intended to slow the spread of the coronavirus. https://t.co/hXedQlkOOq

name: axios
text: Tulsa City-County Health Department director Bruce Dart says he wishes Trump would postpone his campaign rally, citing a "significant increase" in coronavirus case trends that could put both the public and the president himself at risk. https://t.co/BaSstqGgha

name: axios
text: “I think it’s an honor for Tulsa to have a sitting president want to come and visit our community, but not during a pandemic," Dart said. https://t.co/BaSstqGgha

name: axios
text: Gov. Andrew Cuomo threatened to reverse New York's phased reopening after the state received 25,000 complaints that businesses — particularly in Manhattan and the Hamptons — were in violation of public health restrictions. https://t.co/fOxOzDuynU
